intro: Matelea alabamensis, commonly known as the Alabama mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Matelea alabamensis typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas.
